Name: open
Description: Open a file and return a file descriptor.

Name: fstat
Description: Get file status from a file descriptor.

Name: lstat
Description: Get file status without following symbolic links.

Name: poll
Description: Wait for some events on a file descriptor.

Name: mmap
Description: Map files or devices into memory.

Name: mprotect
Description: Set protection on a region of memory.

Name: munmap
Description: Unmap files or devices from memory.

Name: rt_sigaction
Description: Examine and change a signal action.

Name: pread64
Description: Read from a file descriptor at a specified offset.

Name: pwrite64
Description: Write to a file descriptor at a specified offset.

Name: access
Description: Check user's permissions for a file.

Name: msync
Description: Synchronize a file with a memory map.

Name: mincore
Description: Determine whether pages are resident in memory.

Name: madvise
Description: Give advice about use of memory.

Name: dup2
Description: Duplicate a file descriptor to a specified file descriptor.

Name: getitimer
Description: Get value of an interval timer.

Name: alarm
Description: Set a timer to deliver a signal.

Name: setitimer
Description: Set value of an interval timer.

Name: connect
Description: Initiate a connection on a socket.

Name: accept
Description: Accept a connection on a socket.

Name: sendto
Description: Send a message on a socket.

Name: recvfrom
Description: Receive a message from a socket.

Name: sendmsg
Description: Send a message on a socket.

Name: recvmsg
Description: Receive a message from a socket.

Name: shutdown
Description: Shut down part of a full-duplex connection.

Name: bind
Description: Bind a name to a socket.

Name: listen
Description: Listen for connections on a socket.

Name: getpeername
Description: Get name of connected peer socket.

Name: socketpair
Description: Create a pair of connected sockets.

Name: vfork
Description: Create a child process and block parent.

Name: wait4
Description: Wait for process to change state.

Name: kill
Description: Send a signal to a process.

Name: semget
Description: Get set of System V semaphores.

Name: msgsnd
Description: Send message to System V message queue.

Name: msgrcv
Description: Receive message from System V message queue.

Name: flock
Description: Apply or remove an advisory lock on an open file.

Name: fsync
Description: Synchronize a file's in-core state with storage device.

Name: fdatasync
Description: Synchronize a file's data with storage device.

Name: truncate
Description: Truncate a file to a specified length.

Name: ftruncate
Description: Truncate a file to a specified length.

Name: rename
Description: Change the name or location of a file.

Name: link
Description: Make a new name for a file.

Name: unlink
Description: Delete a name and possibly the file it refers to.

Name: symlink
Description: Make a new name for a file.

Name: readlink
Description: Read value of a symbolic link.

Name: lchown
Description: Change ownership of a symbolic link.

Name: syslog
Description: Read and/or clear kernel message ring buffer; set console_loglevel.

Name: setsid
Description: Create session and set process group ID.

Name: setreuid
Description: Set real and effective user IDs.

Name: setregid
Description: Set real and effective group IDs.

Name: rt_sigqueueinfo
Description: Send a signal in real time.

Name: utime
Description: Set file access and modification times.

Name: mknod
Description: Create a special or ordinary file.

Name: vhangup
Description: Virtually hang up the current tty.

Name: acct
Description: Switch process accounting on or off.

Name: exit_group
Description: Terminate all threads in a process.

Name: tgkill
Description: Send signal to a thread group.

Name: utimes
Description: Set file access and modification times.

Name: mq_timedsend
Description: Send a message to a queue.

Name: mq_timedreceive
Description: Receive a message from a queue.

Name: kexec_load
Description: Load a new kernel for later execution.

Name: waitid
Description: Wait for process to change state.

Name: add_key
Description: Add a key to the kernel keyring.

Name: request_key
Description: Request a key from the kernel keyring.

Name: openat

Name: mkdirat

Name: mknodat

Name: futimesat

Name: newfstatat

Name: renameat

Name: linkat

Name: symlinkat

Name: readlinkat
Description: Read value of a symbolic link relative to a directory file descriptor.

Name: fchmodat

Name: faccessat
Description: Check user's permissions for a file relative to a directory file descriptor.

Name: sync_file_range

Name: vmsplice
